column4: In the event where you cannot access a graphical interface, the command line should still work.
I can still..I just wan't to reinstall the original packages without wiping everything. Is there a relatively simple way?
Assuming the dependency check in place.. you can try to install the ubuntu-desktop package and hope that the relavent packages are pulled back in?
What are the commands to do this?
sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop
This is only an attempt and I can't gurantee the results.
Ok, could it result in loss?
No, there is no chance of loss that I can tell, most it will do is nothing. That will not touch your /home
Ok, I'll give it a go
Best case, original packages pulled in and restored, worst case, GUI dies data stays intact
In LXDE if I try to pull up the udate manager I get - 'E:Type 'ain' is not known on line 3 in source list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/gnome3-team-gnome3-natty.list'
please pastebin this file too /etc/apt/sources.list.d/gnome3-team-gnome3-natty.list
http://pastebin.com/uGFw0icW
I think thats the problem.. :)
Yes, you nailed, it, please make the correction to it? :)
Remove line 3?
Yes place.
It wont let me edit it o_0
use a command line editor like nano or vi or vim
Ok
sudo vim /path/to/file
Ok, thats working. Ran ppa purge on the Gnome3 ppa
Should I try sudo aptget install ubuntu-desktop now?
Made those changes..rebooting. Thanks for your help
